properties.abstract:
The shortest and quickest connection between Dagro and Capanna Quarnei is the gentle «Sentiero dei Monti» via Monda and Vipéra; above this trail, mostly around the timberline, runs the equally well maintained «Sentiero degli Alpi» via Alpe di Cióu and Prato di Cüm. Both trails are well marked and offer a beautiful view into Val Malvaglia, the largest side valley of Valle di Blenio.
However, there is a third variant, running on the "outside" and entering Val Malvaglia "through the roof": past Cima di Piancabella to the west, below Cima di Gana Rossa, across Cima di Gana Bianca and finally across Gane di Terra Rossa down to Capanna Quarnei. A «gana» (or «ganna») is a rockslide zone with large boulders or a field of coarse scree. And that is exactly what you encounter: between Piano del Simano and Piano dell’Alpe you hike on huge boulders trying to keep your balance.
properties.subtitle: Gane bianche e rosse
properties.title: Traverse from Dagro to Capanna Quarnei

sac_photos.title: Tiresome block terrain on the final ascent to Cima di Gana Bianca.
Cima di Gana Bianca, an elegant mountain made of scree and rubble. View from the north.
